activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:44 AM Defendant Jordan J Zahurance in court.  Attorney Kaitlin Elizabeth Dippolito in court for Jordan J Zahurance.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Formal reading of Complaint waived.  Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing set.  Address confirmed and phone number provided/updated.  Bail continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:08 AM Defendant Jordan J Zahurance in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE relates he qualifies for Public Defender.  Attorney Steuer relates Attorney Dippolito has been appointed and requests reset.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:20 PM Defendant Jordan J Zahurance appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre appeared by video for Jordan J Zahurance, for today.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 

Attorney Longacre relates. 
State requests bond. 
Defendant relates. 
Court orders $200.00 cash bond. 
Next hearing to be in person, in front of Judge Boyle.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
